data.title: Bec and Lleyton Hewitt's children: Who are they and what are they doing now?
data.meta_description: Lleyton Hewitt and Bec Hewitt's three children, Mia, Cruz and Ava, are each paving their own path to greatn...
data.text:
Ask any celebrity offspring and they'll likely say it's not easy growing up in the spotlight. Even more so when your parents are an Aussie power couple like Lleyton Hewitt and Bec Hewitt.

But their three children, Mia, Cruz and Ava, are each paving their own path to greatness, and soon enough they'll likely outshine the tennis champ and the actress.

Overnight, Ava and Cruz have joined their parents at the Australian Open to celebrate Lleyton's incredible achievement of becoming the 47th Australian Tennis Hall of Fame inductee.

READ MORE: One move raises eyebrows as Harry, Meghan hit red carpet

It was a family affair, but eldest daughter Mia wasn't in attendance.

During a court-side interview, the tennis star gave a shout-out to his family: "I'd like to thank my family as well ‚Äì Bec and the kids for all their support over the years."

Commemorated with a bronze statue, Lleyton continued, "It's something incredibly special and what a tournament this is," Hewitt added.

"It's a great honour that it can happen here (at the Australian Open)."

Read on to find out what the Hewitt kids are up to these days.

Cruz Hewitt, 15

While big sis Mia sets her sights on fashion runways, Cruz wants to follow in Dad's footsteps.

This weekend saw tennis fans experiencing serious d√©j√† vu, watching Cruz's uncanny resemblance to his father.

The 15-year-old received a wildcard entry to the Australian Open 2024 Junior Championships.

His tennis star father Hewitt, a former world No. 1, supported his son on the court beside him.

The youngest player in the draw, Hewitt was defeated by by Razeghi, losing 6-2 6-3 in 1 hour and 26 minutes.

The father-son duo even shared a warm up game together on the morning of the match, training on Show court 3, the same court where Lleyton also made his main match debut.

READ MORE: Everything you need to know about the Samsung Galaxy S24 before it hits the shelves

"Just unbelievably proud, to be honest," Lleyton Hewitt said to WWOS prior to the match.

"Just some great memories coming back of me playing here. He's been around the traps, but he's worked extremely hard to get this opportunity. He is playing well."

The promising tennis star previously won the Under 12s Australian Claycourt Championships title for 2021.

READ MORE: Single gesture which 'confirmed' tennis star's romance

Naturally, Lleyton was courtside for the Canberra tournament.

"National Claycourt Champ @cruzhewitt #TeamCruz üèÜ," the proud dad said of the event.

In 2022, Cruz got his first ITF title in Fiji.

Mia Hewitt, 18

Bec may have taken over Aussie TV screens back in her acting heyday, but her daughter Mia may soon take over runways across the globe.

The 18-year-old has expressed a keen interest in fashion and modelling and she certainly has the style for it.

In 2019, Mia rubbed shoulders with the who's-who of the fashion world when she accompanied her famous mum to Paris Fashion Week to attend a number of runway shows together, including the coveted Dior show.

"@dior Thank you for the most magical two days!! So inspired!#dior #fashion #paris #hautecouture #30montaigne," Bec captioned a photo of them from the event.

He's the son of one of the most famous faces in the world

She is now believed to be studying fashion design.

Mia's effortless style has also impressed her mum, who now calls the teenager her fashion muse.

"Happy Birthday to my style icon! @miarebeccaofficial," the proud mum previously captioned an Instagram post.

Ava Hewitt, 12

Ava may be the youngest of the brood, but she's keeping up with the rest of the family.

In her Instagram bio (yes, she has Instagram and boasts thousands of followers!), Ava links out to the dancing, acting and modelling agencies she's affiliated with.

READ MORE: Katie Boulter and Alex de Minaur spark engagement rumours

For a daily dose of 9Honey, sign up here to receive our top stories straight to your inbox

What's more, Ava is an avid gymnast, having competed at the Victorian Championships back in 2018. Impressive.

She even appeared in a national advertising campaign for Target.

"Had the best time filming this TVC for @targetaus How gorgeous is the Kelpie?!" she previously captioned a clip from the ad.
